entry.title: Introduce kServiceWorkerRegistrationCache feature
entry.content:
Before this CL, even if there was an already running ServiceWorker,

calling FindRegistrationForClientUrl() was necessary on navigation to

get the proper service worker registration information. This CL caches

registration_id and gets a live registration without calling

FindRegistrationForClientUrl() mojo API.



How this CL works:



`registration_scope_cache_` provides all of scope information that

belongs to StorageKey. By using this scope list, we can know which scope

URL should be used for the given client URL. After scope URL is

determined, `registration_id_cache_` provides registration_id. Actual

ServiceWorkerRegistration object is maintained in

ServiceWorkerContextCore::live_registrations_ while

ServiceWorkerRegistration object is alive.



Bug: 1446216

Change-Id: Id977a409007c94dc9b9b2f1f62be8acb0f02fc7b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4542783

entry.title: Prerender: Deflake AddSpeculationRulesMultipleTimes test
entry.content:
This CL re-enables AddSpeculationRulesMultipleTimes test with

kPrerender2IgnoreFailureOnMemoryFootprintQuery flag disabled.



> Context



https://crrev.com/c/4542126 disabled the test as flakiness. This

flakiness was caused by the CL to ignore failures on query about memory

usage and let prerendering start (https://crrev.com/c/4520597).

AddSpeculationRulesMultipleTimes test depends on the number of

kFailToGetMemoryUsage and kMemoryLimitExceeded failures but the CL

allowed to ignore kFailToGetMemoryUsage and the expected count gets

confused. This resulted in the test flakiness.



By forcibly disabling the flag, the test should run in a stable manner as

before.



> Another option this CL doesn't take



Instead of forcibly disable the flag on the test, we could completely

remove the test. However, there could still be a possibility to disable

the flag for some reason, so this CL keeps the test, just in case.



Bug: 1444521

Change-Id: I8c22ac3e2f0da8feb8d98a19d518b8361c1116bd

entry.title: Show magnifier during swipe to move cursor gesture for CrOS.
entry.content:
Add HandleSwipeToMoveCursorGestureAck to notify touch selection

controllers and clients of insertion drag events when swipe to move

cursor is occurring. This enables existing magnifier logic in

TouchSelectionControllerClientAura to be reused for showing a magnifier

during a swipe to move cursor gesture. (Note that the actual magnifier

is only implemented for CrOS, though the magnifier handling logic is

shared aura code.)



The overall approach sort of tries to follow the corresponding Android

implementation:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:content/browser/renderer_host/render_widget_host_view_android.cc;l=3189;drc=fe8fa98aca34ccf3b40d3a65893dc72a48a07c52

There are some small differences due to some implementation details.

May be worth trying to unify the implementations a bit more in a later

CL.



Bug: b:244116654, b:278797737

Change-Id: I530381d40f81cd4b489f68e07322522e19e526e1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4531506

Reviewed-by: K. Moon

entry.title: feedback: Do not create a new instant if one exists already
entry.content:
When an instant of the new feedback app has been created, further

request to open the app again should reuse the existing instant.



Current behavior:



- The existing instant is unloaded.

- A new instant is created.



This may cause the description entered get lost.



- Check whether there is an instant existing already.

- If yes, simply show it.

- If no, launch a new instant.



Bug: b:283145415

Test:

1) press ALt+Shift+I to open the feedback app.

2) Enter some text, say "testing...".

3) Click the "Tips on writing feedback" link.

4) Observe that the link is opened and its page is focused.

5) Visit About Chrome from settings, click "Send Feedback".

6) Observe that the feedback app is brought back to focused.

7) Observe that the text entered before is still there.



Change-Id: I1e45e25779bcf374df7289683696bbaf0076fd78

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4547919

Commit-Queue: Xiangdong Kong

entry.title: Revert "Use patched jacoco 0.8.3"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 644ec05905b3df284822950bbedfef7833c843ce.



Reason for revert: This breaks local junit code coverage.



.exec files are not generated anymore when ran locally. Bisect pinpointed this as culprit CL.

entry.title: Enable swipe to move cursor under touch text editing redesign flag.
entry.content:
The swipe to move cursor feature is already launched for Android. In

this CL, we add it to other platforms under the touch text editing

redesign flag (which includes various other touch text editing features,

see WIP design doc: go/cros-touch-text-editing. Note that this is

primarily planned for CrOS but may also be enabled for other platforms

eventually).



To prevent the swipe to move cursor control feature from interfering

with other similar gesture features (long press drag selection and

double press drag selection), we add add an extra allow_cursor_control_

condition to TouchActionFilter. This prevents cursor control from taking

over when a long press has occurred in the current gesture sequence.



(Once double press drag selection is implemented, we will also prevent

cursor control from taking over when a double press has occurred. See

crrev/c/4297101)

entry.title: [GridNG] Fix crash when animating subgrid tracks
entry.content:
InterpolableGridTrackList interpolates the size of grid tracks for

animation. This can't be supported on subgrids, because subgrid track

definitions cannot contain sizes to interpolate, as they inherit sizes

from their parent grid. All other callers of `RepeatSize` are already

checking for subgrids, but this case was missed.



A unit test was added under the fast directory, as that's where crash

tests are typically stored.

entry.title: webauthn: allow optional JSON fields to be omitted.
entry.content:
In https://github.com/w3c/webauthn/pull/1878, the spec for the JSON

representation of WebAuthn requests changes so that missing optional

fields are omitted rather than null.



This change allows Chromium to parse either style. Once this has been

around for a while, we can change the `ToValue` functions to omit

fields.



Since the blink/ parts aren't launched yet, immediately update them to

omit the userHandle rather than produce a null value. (The

authenticatorAttachment was already omitted when needed.)



Bug: 1427843

Change-Id: I5a5baa698759ae4dba678457d043114e15b57eca

entry.content:
Sites automatically allowlisted under HTTPS-Upgrades shouldn't affect

HTTPS-First Mode (as the user has not explicitly allowed them as there

was no warning shown), and vice versa. This CL updates the

HttpsFirstModeService which tracks the HTTPS-First Mode pref to also

clear the HTTP allowlist whenever that pref changes.

entry.title: [SPEAK-ON-MUTE] Bind speak-on-mute pref to CRAS.
entry.content:
Add pref observer to the CRAS so that the speak-on-mute detection is now

controlled from the privacy hub settings. During the initialization, the

detection is also enabled based on the pref setting.



Pref registry is moved to CRAS as it is initialized before privacy hub

is created.

A new pref "kUserSpeakOnMuteDetectionOptIn" is added, which is used by

the system UI side if user has opted-in the som feature.



This is developed behind a chrome flag.



'*CrasAudioHandlerTest.SpeakOnMuteDetectionPrefSwitchTest*'



Bug: b/280925839

TEST: chromeos_unittests --gtest_filter=

entry.title: [build] Export new/delete symbols on CrOS
entry.content:
Starting 23rd of March, ChromeOS's UI would halt forever and rapidly

leak memory due to an infinite loop in GPU channel code when LLVM's

Scudo Hardened Allocator was enabled. This was eventually bisected to

a libassistant shared object dependency change.



They may seem entirely unrelated, but removing the libassistant

shared object changed how the GPU channel code does its

allocations because of how the ELF symbol exports changed on the

ChromeOS build target. This causes the infinite hang and the leak.



This commit forces these symbols to be exported, and forces the

news used here to match their deletes. This prevents preloads from

changing the Chrome allocator.



Bug: b:280115910

Test: Tested on ChromeOS volteer device with scudo preloaded

entry.content:
This patch adds `NGScoreLineBreakContext` because it turned

out that there are more than just `NGLineInfoList` that are

needed to be kept across lines for the `text-wrap: pretty`.

The `NGInlineChildLayoutContext` is changed to keep this new

class instead of `NGLineInfoList`.



The `NGScoreLineBreakContext` in this patch has only

`NGLineInfoList`, but following patches will add more.



This patch has no behavior changes because changes are all

under a runtime flag.

entry.title: Correctly rebuild cc::PaintCanvas matrix stack when layers are used.
entry.content:
Whenever a frame is rendered while layers are opened (e.g. by calling

getImageData between calls to beginLayer and endLayer), the

cc::PaintCanvas stack have to be flushed and all layer closed. This stack

then has to be rebuilt, re-opening any layers that were previously

opened.

entry.title: [iOS] Prevent crash when scheduling start up cleanup tasks
entry.content:
On app start up and in cases when session cookies should be cleared, the

main controller would clear the session cookies in the regular browser.

With incognito browser, however, it only does so when there exist tabs

in the incognito browser, because cookies for each tab are cleared when

the tab is closed.



However, sometimes when the user backgrounds the app on start up, the

incognito browser may be destroyed, causing the incognito browser to be

`nil`. When that happens, the app essentially calls

`nil->GetWebStateList` and will result in a crash like the following:



https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?q=ReportId%3D%27c34849ff2f3716bd%27&stbtiq=&reportid=&index=0



This CL checks incognito browser existence before clearing cookies, so

that the crash could be prevented.



Unused helper methods are also removed.



Bug: 1427703

entry.title: shortcuts: Delay scrollIntoView by 150ms
entry.content:
Fixes a bug where if the device is in tablet mode, clicking on a

search result would not scroll to the correct accelerator. The root

cause of the bug is that the virtual keyboard's animations disrupts

smooth scrolling. The fix is to add a 150ms delay on the initial

smooth scroll (fixes the bug for most use cases) and add a fallback

retry after another 150ms delay.

entry.title: [scheduler] Check for null frame scheduler in MainThreadTaskQueue
entry.content:
A MainThreadTaskQueue will be alive with a null frame scheduler when the

queue is detached from the frame scheduler, and some methods weren't

checking this (e.g. OnWebSchedulingTaskQueueDestroyed()). This adds the

necessary checks for methods that might be called in this state.

entry.title: [scroll-animations] Add DeferredTimeline
entry.content:
A DeferredTimeline is a ScrollSnapshotTimeline that takes its

TimelineState from another ScrollSnapshotTimeline. This can be

used to implement timeline-scope, as described in Issue 7759 [1].



This CL adds the management of DeferredTimeline in CSSAnimations,

but does not yet add the timeline attachment behavior. For now,

deferred timelines are always just inactive.



Bug: 1425939



[1] https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/7759

entry.title: [Extensions] Add support for `windowId` in `sidePanel.open()`
entry.content:
Add support for specifying `windowId` in `sidePanel.open()`. This

allows extensions to open a global panel in the specified window. If

both `windowId` and `tabId` are specified, this requires the tab to

belong to the window indicated by `windowId`. Assuming it does, the

behavior is the same as if only `tabId` were specified.

entry.title: Migrate HTMLCanvasElement from TopDocument() to GetDocument().
entry.content:
The URL is just used for annotation purposes; there's no need to use

TopDocument() here, which is misleading in cross-process iframes, since

it returns the Document of the local root instead. Several other places

already pass the document URL instead of the "top" document URL, so this

brings more in line with the other uses anyway.



Also rename the various parameters and places it's plumbed through to

remove "top" from the name.



Bug: 617677

entry.title: Merge CustomWrappableAdapter into CustomWrapper
entry.content:
CustomWrappable lives in platform/ so that V8DOMWrapper can know

about it. CustomWrappableAdapter lives in core/ so that it can use

SetupIDLInterfaceTemplate(). CustomWrappableAdapter also has some

other methods that are now unused.



CustomWrappable doesn't need all of SetupIDLInterfaceTemplate(),

though. It really just needs to set the internal field count, which

is a direct operation on the v8 API, so it's straightforward to

flatten the class hierarchy here.



While tweaking CustomWrappable, refactor its sole consumer to be

better encapsulated.



Change-Id: I41000e61b73c74e3fd387fc4c99d15cbc95f2e79

entry.title: Remove the feature flag for direct memory allocations on Android
entry.content:
The flag has gone into M114, this should be enough to run the

experiment in Stable and estimate performance gains.



Now we remove it and instead make Android builds always allocate SMB

directly. This will allow to start early tracing at any time and unblock

the migration to Perfetto SDK on Android.

entry.title: windows-pen: make hover tooltips appear
entry.content:
Currently, tooltips for buttons on the URL bar (e.g., back/forward,

refresh, extensions menu) for and shortcuts on the NTP appear when

hovered over with the mouse, but not with a pen/stylus.



When a mouse-move event happens over an object that creates a tooltip

(such as the above buttons), TooltipStateManager::Show() is called.

Show() sets a half-second timer after which the tooltip will actually

show. It resets the timer every time it's called, so the tooltip only

actually shows when there is a pause in mouse-move events, i.e., when

the mouse stops moving.



This doesn't work for pen/stylus input - on Windows, when the pen

hovers, it continually sends mouse-move events, even if its position

is held steady. This causes tooltips for objects using

TooltipStateManager to not show for pen/stylus.



This change makes Show() only be called once for consecutive pen-move

events with the same text.



Bug: 1429423

Change-Id: Iabead045818051d040a8727c7fdc6dd3120743b0

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Avoid blocking event listeners
entry.content:
In , an if check in the ready() lifecycle method

potentially stopped subsequent LoC from executing. Some of these

lines registered event listeners. To mitigate the issue, the

problematic code was extracted to a separate function to ensure

subsequent LoC would be executed.

entry.title: sql: Make ShouldAttemptRecovery consider the database to be recovered
entry.content:
Most database error callbacks just check Recovery::ShouldRecover, which

takes just an error code, before attempting to recover the database.

Unfortunately, it may not actually be valid to attempt to recover the

given database (e.g. if it's closed)



This CL makes BuiltInRecovery::ShouldAttemptRecovery take a Database

arg to check whether recovering the database is allowed in the first

place. This is much more straightforward than requiring every call site

to know (and consistently check) the exact conditions under which

recovery is allowed (or silently failing recovery in these cases)



Bug: 1385500

Change-Id: I60320fc9c1059bcae1aa7f6ad5794dfe98414d93

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4545213

Commit-Queue: Austin Sullivan

entry.title: [Autofill] Enable custom card art in the iOS keyboard accessory
entry.content:
This CL creates and adds an AutofillImageFetcher to the

PersonalDataManager on iOS, which enables downloading custom

card art as long as kAutofillEnableCardArtImage is set (this flag

is also added to chrome://flags for iOS too).



If a custom card icon was downloaded and is available, it will then

be set into the FormSuggestion by the AutofillAgent, and used in

the FormSuggestionLabel in preference over the default icon (i.e.,

the card network icon).

entry.title: Fix UAF in ECDSASoftwareKey and RSASoftwareKey DeleteKey implementation
entry.content:
Code in ECDSASoftwareKey and RSASoftwareKey DeleteKey was calling

NCryptDeleteKey to delete a key. Since the ScopedNCryptKey RAII object

still had what it thought was a valid handle to the key, it

subsequently called NCryptFreeObject on the key when it went out of

scope, causing a double free.



Since NCryptDeleteKey can sometimes fail in circumstances not under

the application's control, we need to check the return value and

free the key on failure.



Change-Id: Id614cbc1916d49800c72557cb18a9fe1fa113eda

entry.title: Revert "[Thumbnail Cache] Improve refetch logic to minimize ETC1 decompression"
entry.content:
This reverts commit d2cf34a746e4cc9d7ce2c1b4fec08722072a2699.



Reason for revert: causing some CQ flakes.



Original change's description:

> [Thumbnail Cache] Improve refetch logic to minimize ETC1 decompression

>

> ETC1 decompression is quite slow and we are doing it needlessly for

> refetch when no thumbnail exists. Avoid this by creating a more robust

> JPEG refetch path that waits for a thumbnail to be available.

>

> We cannot remove ETC1 refetch entirely yet because of how aspect ratio

> is currently used.

>

> I'm working on a future patchset to either

> * Ignore aspect ratio for refetch entirely

> OR

> * Wait for a new JPEG if the aspect ratio is very off. And falling back

> to the existing JPEG otherwise.

>

> However these depend on changing how we treat aspect ratio on phones

> from a fixed value to something dynamic based on screen size. It will

> also depend upon potentially storing a larger JPEG and scaling/cropping

> it to fit on the GTS. This is already partially supported, but requires

> tweaks to not enforce any aspect ratio and just use the native thumbnail

> resolution.

>

> Bug: 1402843

> Change-Id: I74cf56af985541bd6990f6203824cf1d020e602b

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4414020

> Reviewed-by: David Trainor

> Commit-Queue: Calder Kitagawa

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1146018}



Bug: 1402843

Change-Id: I0585e08026f43f3ce5d67a98edc2ab4366de65e8

No-Presubmit: true

No-Tree-Checks: true

No-Try: true
